intro: Sida diversifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf or desert willow, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, violet to blue flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants such as cotton and hibiscus. Sida diversifolia is often used in landscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
